New Records: Endrick became the youngest male player - at 17 years and 246 days - to score an international goal at Wembley.
Key Match Events: Endrick scored the winning goal for Brazil in the 80th minute.
Lucas Paquetá hit the post in the 35th minute.
Jordan Pickford saved a potential second goal from Endrick in the dying seconds.
Pre-Game Insights: England was missing captain Harry Kane and other regulars.
Brazil gave debuts to five players in their starting 11 due to injuries to key players.
Post-Match Reflections: Endrick expressed his happiness and described the goal as a unique feeling.
Gareth Southgate praised his team's performance despite the loss and highlighted the ruthlessness of football at this level.
Southgate confirmed that Harry Kane would not recover in time for Tuesday's friendly against Belgium.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match had an attendance of 83,664 at Wembley Stadium.
